question: What is the population of Fairhaven Township?

content.source_1: the census of 2000, there were 1,458 people, 510 households, and 401 families residing in the township. The population density was 42.9 people per square mile (16.6/km²). There were 596 housing units at an average density of 17.5/sq mi (6.8/km²). The racial makeup of the township was 98.77% White, 0.41% African American, 0.62% Native American, 0.07% Asian, and 0.14% from two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 0.55% of the population. content.source_2: Fairhaven Township, Michigan Fairhaven Township is a civil township of Huron County in the U.S. state of Michigan. The population was 1,259 at the 2000 census. According to the United States Census Bureau, the township has a total area of , of which is land and (63.67%) is water. As of the census of 2000, there were 1,259 people, 537 households, and 353 families residing in the township. The population density was 59.7 per square mile (23.1/km²).
